page.title: 06POPULATION 1 BISHOP THORNTON
page.content: The population in 1861 was 541. The population in the 1981 census was only 384. We think that the population has decreased because there is now no work for the people. One of the Mills at Shaw Mills closed down and the other changed to a leather and suede curing factory for many years but has recently closed down altogether. However the Council are asking the Development Commision to allocate funds for a craft workshop and housing scheme to be started in the old mill. This will provide an opportunity for craftsmen and women to work from home, boosting the local economy and providing housing for local people.Another reason for the decline in the population is that the bus service is very poor, only 2 buses a day and 3 buses every Tuesday and Thursday.
